channel.title: Iron Horse Interactive
channel.description: IHI provides global brands with fully integrated solutions that drive demand and generate revenue for their products.

item.title: Security Bots Will Battle in Vegas for DARPA's Hacking Crown
item.description: It’s time for seven supercomputers to take off their satin robes and step into the ring. The U.S. Defense Department research project DARPA is pitting coders’ security bots against each other as part of the $55 million hacking contest taking place in Vegas this week.

item.title: Two Ways to Stop Ransomware in Its Tracks
item.description: The long and annoying reign of cryptographic ransomware — on both companies and consumers alike — might soon be coming to a close thanks to new monitoring and scanning systems. And with an average ransomware fee going from $294 in 2015 to $679 this year, it’s not a moment too soon.

item.title: Here's What Your Boring App Would Look Like as a Conversation
item.description: Most enterprise software isn’t exactly known for being fun or intuitive. Its purpose is to tell knowledge workers what’s important, what to do next, or how to take their next action. One solution for delivering that info faster — and less dryly — is for software to chat it up via conversational interface.

item.title: How Salesforce Keeps Its Release Mojo by Making Everyone a Product Designer
item.description: Here’s a little secret to Salesforce’s success: Project managers are “business designers,” developers are “technology designers” … you get the idea. Making the perspective shift with an eye for collaboration pays off big-time when, as Tim Gunn would say, companies learn to “make it work.”
